body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#25573](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25573) ([POC] guix: produce a fully -static-pie x86_64 bitcoind using GCC and glibc by fanquake)
* [#24123](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24123) (build: Pointer Authentication and Branch Target Identification for aarch64 Linux (Guix) by fanquake)
* [#21778](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/21778) (build: LLVM 14 & LLD based macOS toolchain by fanquake)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

I failed to build both this PR and the patched rc2 for the platform triple `x86_64-linux-gnu` (Guix commit 39dcbc7fa3c02ff5c9682f25e1c29667dbfe7827)

```
INFO: Building 4c35ccb86dbe for platform triple x86_64-linux-gnu:
      ...using reference timestamp: 1666254014
      ...running at most 32 jobs
      ...from worktree directory: '/home/guix/bitcoin'
          ...bind-mounted in container to: '/bitcoin'
      ...in build directory: '/home/guix/bitcoin/guix-build-4c35ccb86dbe/distsrc-4c35ccb86dbe-x86_64-linux-gnu'
          ...bind-mounted in container to: '/distsrc-base/distsrc-4c35ccb86dbe-x86_64-linux-gnu'
      ...outputting in: '/home/guix/bitcoin/guix-build-4c35ccb86dbe/output/x86_64-linux-gnu'
          ...bind-mounted in container to: '/outdir-base/x86_64-linux-gnu'
Required environment variables as seen inside the container:
    DIST_ARCHIVE_BASE: /outdir-base/dist-archive
    DISTNAME: bitcoin-4c35ccb86dbe
    HOST: x86_64-linux-gnu
    SOURCE_DATE_EPOCH: 1666254014
    JOBS: 32
    DISTSRC: /distsrc-base/distsrc-4c35ccb86dbe-x86_64-linux-gnu
    OUTDIR: /outdir-base/x86_64-linux-gnu
'/gnu/store/zh29y5bw1j0yw2i66qy640g9lj1fzl85-gcc-cross-x86_64-linux-gnu-10.3.0-lib")))/lib/gcc/x86_64-linux-gnu/*/include' doesn't exist or isn't a directory... Abortingâ¦
```

Similar error for `arm-linux-gnueabihf`, `aarch64-linux-gnu`, `riscv64-linux-gnu`, `powerpc64le-linux-gnu`, `x86_64-w64-mingw32`.

But I did manage to build `apple-darwin-unsigned` and `arm64-apple-darwin`. I tested that the Apple (Intel) binary actually works.

`powerpc64-linux-gnu` failed with a different error:

```
INFO: Building f3fb6d2d4174 for platform triple powerpc64-linux-gnu:
      ...using reference timestamp: 1666254014
      ...running at most 32 jobs
      ...from worktree directory: '/home/guix/bitcoin'
          ...bind-mounted in container to: '/bitcoin'
      ...in build directory: '/home/guix/bitcoin/guix-build-f3fb6d2d4174/distsrc-f3fb6d2d4174-powerpc64-linux-gnu'
          ...bind-mounted in container to: '/distsrc-base/distsrc-f3fb6d2d4174-powerpc64-linux-gnu'
      ...outputting in: '/home/guix/bitcoin/guix-build-f3fb6d2d4174/output/powerpc64-linux-gnu'
          ...bind-mounted in container to: '/outdir-base/powerpc64-linux-gnu'
Backtrace:
In srfi/srfi-1.scm:
   586:29 19 (map1 (#<<manifest-entry> name: "python-lief" versio?> ?))
   586:17 18 (map1 (#<<manifest-entry> name: "powerpc64-linux-gnu-t?>))
In guix/profiles.scm:
  1974:19 17 (_ _)
In guix/packages.scm:
  1279:17 16 (supported-package? #<package powerpc64-linux-gnu-tool?> ?)
In guix/memoization.scm:
    101:0 15 (_ #<hash-table 7fe44998ae20 704/883> #<package powerp?> ?)
In guix/packages.scm:
  1249:12 14 (_)
In srfi/srfi-1.scm:
   460:18 13 (fold #<procedure 7fe447e7de80 at guix/packages.scm:12?> ?)
In guix/packages.scm:
  1253:42 12 (_ _ ("x86_64-linux" "i686-linux"))
In guix/memoization.scm:
    101:0 11 (_ #<hash-table 7fe44998ae20 704/883> #<package glibc-?> ?)
In guix/packages.scm:
  1249:12 10 (_)
In srfi/srfi-1.scm:
   460:18  9 (fold #<procedure 7fe447e82b60 at guix/packages.scm:12?> ?)
In guix/packages.scm:
  1253:42  8 (_ _ ("x86_64-linux" "i686-linux"))
In guix/memoization.scm:
    101:0  7 (_ #<hash-table 7fe44998ae20 704/883> #<package linux-?> ?)
In guix/packages.scm:
  1257:37  6 (_)
  1517:16  5 (package->bag _ _ _ #:graft? _)
  1622:43  4 (thunk)
In guix/build-system/gnu.scm:
   188:19  3 (arguments _)
In gnu/packages/cross-base.scm:
   352:33  2 (loop (#:phases (modify-phases %standard-phases # ?) ?) #)
In ice-9/boot-9.scm:
  1685:16  1 (raise-exception _ #:continuable? _)
  1685:16  0 (raise-exception _ #:continuable? _)

ice-9/boot-9.scm:1685:16: In procedure raise-exception:
In procedure struct-vtable: Wrong type argument in position 1 (expecting struct): #f
```

Trying the same build on my existing Guix machine to see if this perhaps a hardware / system setup issue.

Using the latest guix master commit (4716cea6256523a8ecf90a426d675bfb7620f3e4) results in the same errors.

If I remove the spurious `")))` then the path does exist. There's probably something wrong with the regex here (though it hasn't been touched in years):
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/995fdef14af2a8a97381d412e66a9b92192b39e1/contrib/guix/libexec/build.sh#L50-L57

Added some `&2> echo` statements in that function and narrowed it down to `store_path() linux-libre-headers-cross-x86_64-linux-gnu` and `gcc-cross-x86_64-linux-gnu [lib]` adding spurious brackets.

Which may be because the manifest file looks like so:
```
          (propagated-inputs
            (("linux-libre-headers-cross-x86_64-linux-gnu"
              "5.15.52"
              "out"
              "/gnu/store/3wl72wb29malv3idmpay05xj9l1xiir0-linux-libre-headers-cross-x86_64-linux-gnu-5.15.52")))
```

Added a commit that fixes the `store_path` regex to also drop closing brackets.

The `powerpc64-linux-gnu` still fails like it did above.
